Info.Description: Gives the image a three-dimensional, embossed look as if it has been stamped or raised. It achieves this effect by highlighting and shadowing the edges in the image, providing a sense of depth and texture.

Properties.Name: Strength
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the intensity of the embossing effect. A higher strength value increases the contrast between the highlighted and shadowed areas, enhancing the 3D effect, while a lower value creates a subtler effect.

Properties.Name: Radius
Properties.Summary: Determines the size of the area around each pixel that the filter considers when calculating the emboss effect. A larger radius will result in broader, smoother edges, while a smaller radius will create finer, sharper edges.

Properties.Name: Angle
Properties.Summary: Sets the apparent light source direction for the emboss effect. Changing the angle alters the direction of the highlights and shadows, which can give the impression of a different light source direction.

Properties.Name: Color Percentage
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the proportion of the original color retained in the embossed image. A higher percentage keeps more of the original colors, while a lower percentage results in an image closer to a traditional monochrome emboss effect.
